transportAdvice: Lyon has an extensive public transit network including metro, tram, and bus lines that connect most tourist areas efficiently, making it easy to get around without a car. The historic districts of Vieux-Lyon and Presqu'île are compact and very walkable, and taxis are readily available throughout the city.

weather.description: Cold and grey with occasional frost; pack warm layers and expect overcast skies.
Still chilly but days begin to lengthen slightly; rain and cloud remain common.
Early spring brings milder temperatures and occasional sunny spells mixed with showers.
Pleasant spring weather with blooming parks, though afternoon showers are frequent.
Warm and increasingly sunny; one of the most enjoyable months to visit Lyon.
Warm summer conditions with long days; occasional thunderstorms possible in the afternoon.
Hot and mostly sunny; the driest month of the year and ideal for outdoor sightseeing.
Continued summer heat with low rainfall; some businesses may close for August holidays.
Comfortable early autumn temperatures with a mix of sun and occasional rain.
Cooler and wetter as autumn sets in; foliage turns golden across the city's parks.
Damp and grey with frequent rain; the famous Fête des Lumières lights festival occurs in early December.
Cold and festive with Christmas markets; the Fête des Lumières in early December is a major highlight.
